sections.mis: The maximal independent set problem has been widely studied in the LOCAL model. Barenboim et al.Â showed that, if we also consider the dependency in Î”Î”\Delta, MIS can be solved in Oâ€‹(log2â¡Î”)+2Oâ€‹(logâ¡logâ¡n)ğ‘‚superscript2Î”superscript2ğ‘‚ğ‘›O(\log^{2}\Delta)+2^{O(\sqrt{\log\log n})} roundsÂ . Ghaffari improved this running time to Oâ€‹(logâ¡Î”)+2Oâ€‹(logâ¡logâ¡n)ğ‘‚Î”superscript2ğ‘‚ğ‘›O(\log\Delta)+2^{O(\sqrt{\log\log n})} . The MIS problem has been studied also in specific classes of graphs    . For example, for computing MIS on trees with randomized algorithms, Lenzen and Wattenhofer showed an Oâ€‹(logâ¡nâ€‹logâ¡logâ¡n)ğ‘‚ğ‘›ğ‘›O(\sqrt{\log n}\log\log n)-round algorithm  . This was later improved by Barenboim et al.Â to Oâ€‹(logâ¡nâ€‹logâ¡logâ¡n)ğ‘‚ğ‘›ğ‘›O(\sqrt{\log n\log\log n}) , and then further improved to Oâ€‹(logâ¡n)ğ‘‚ğ‘›O(\sqrt{\log n}) by Ghaffari . Barenboim et al.Â also showed that MIS on trees can be solved in Oâ€‹(logâ¡Î”â€‹logâ¡logâ¡Î”+logâ¡logâ¡n/logâ¡logâ¡logâ¡n)ğ‘‚Î”Î”ğ‘›ğ‘›O(\log\Delta\log\log\Delta+\log\log n/\log\log\log n) rounds . Ghaffari later improved this bound to Oâ€‹(logâ¡Î”+logâ¡logâ¡n/logâ¡logâ¡logâ¡n)ğ‘‚Î”ğ‘›ğ‘›O(\log\Delta+\log\log n/\log\log\log n) roundsÂ . While all the above algorithms are randomized, Panconesi and Srinivasan provided a deterministic algorithm for solving MIS in 2Oâ€‹(logâ¡n)superscript2ğ‘‚ğ‘›2^{O(\sqrt{\log n})} roundsÂ . Later, Barenboim, Elkin and Kuhn showed an Oâ€‹(Î”+logâˆ—â¡n)ğ‘‚Î”superscriptğ‘›O(\Delta+\log^{*}n)-round algorithm . Very recently, RozhoÅˆ and Ghaffari proved that MIS can be solved deterministically in polyâ¡(logâ¡n)polyğ‘›\operatorname{poly}(\log n) roundsÂ . Meanwhile, the exponent of the polylog has been improved by Ghaffari et al.Â . The MIS problem has been studied also in the CONGEST101010The CONGEST model is the same as the LOCAL model with the difference that in CONGEST the size of the messages is bounded by Oâ€‹(logâ¡n)ğ‘‚ğ‘›O(\log n) bits. We refer the reader to Section 2.1 for more details on these models. model (e.g., see [ref]23 ).
